newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China EB-IHD to place 133 mln new shares.
newsitem.headline: China EB-IHD to place 133 mln new shares.

text.p: China Everbright-IHD Pacific Ltd said on Monday it would raise net HK$324 million by placing 132.99 million new shares at HK$2.50 per share to its controlling shareholder Honorich Holdings Ltd.

Honorich, which owned by China Everbright Holdings Co Ltd, has agreed to place 113.04 million China Everbright-IHD shares to third parties at HK$2.50 each before subscribing for 132.99 new shares at the same price, the statement said.
China Everbright-IHD shares ended at HK$2.80 on Friday.

Completion of the deal is conditional on Honorich being granting a wavier from making a general offer for the company's shares, it said. On completion of the deal on January 31, the controlling shareholder's stake in the company will be reduced to 45.02 percent from 51.02 percent.
China Everbright-IHD said net proceeds would be used to expand the company's investment portfolio.
The company said it is currently considering a number of possible acquisitions including proposed purchases of investments held by the controlling shareholder.
"Negotiation of the proposed acquistions are only at a preliminary stage and no binding agreement in respect of any of them has been concluded," it said.
